page.title: 08Churches:Nibley/Woodmancote
page.content: Religion is a fairly important part of life in North Nibley as it is a centre for the community which is mainly retired senior citizens. The weekly attendance of the church is about 50. This mainly consists of older and middle aged people, with very few youngsters. Many of the residents do not find time to attend church, although they were brought up as part of the Church of England. The Rev. Fookes is the vicar of the small but beautiful 15th Century medieval church,St.Martin's.Canon Hoskins is the rector of Saint Mark's church in Woodmancote. Again the regular weekly attendants to the church are mostly senior citizens. There was proposal to close the church but this was resisted by those who felt a greater loyalty to it than to the nearby parish church.
